metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20671 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
load_specific_debug_section in objdump.c in GNU Binutils through 2.31.1 contains an integer overflow vulnerability that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow via a crafted section size.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3

binutils-for-build - 2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30-21ubuntu1~18.04.3').
